node.title: Atlanta airport's piano man finds friend for life after stranger showed kindness
node.description: A motivational speaker was moved by Tonee "Valentine" Carter's piano playing.
node.content: ["Atlanta \u2014 Christmas came five months early for Tonee \"Valentine\" Carter, the Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport's piano man.\u00a0", "Though his piano playing is a background diversion for most travelers, one traveler heard him play in July and felt something.\u00a0", "\"It is just radiating off of him and on to me. I feel lighter,\" said Carlos Whittaker, a motivational speaker who asked his 170,000 Instagram followers to donate to a virtual tip jar created for Valentine. \"You don't know, but you got a lot of money coming your way, bro.\"\u00a0", "Whittaker didn't know it, but Carter has health issues and gives himself kidney dialysis nine hours a day. On most days, Carter was lucky to make $100 in tips.\u00a0", "More than $60,000 was donated almost immediately. Over time, strangers showed him love with $85,000 in tips.\u00a0", "\"They made me want to be a better human,\" Carter said. \"It changed my life \u2014 not the money, but the act itself.\"\u00a0", "Whittaker has since created a retirement fund for his new friend.\u00a0", "\"We talk all the time. He's like my son,\" Carter said. \"I made a buddy, more than the money.\"\u00a0", "Mark Strassmann has been a CBS News correspondent since January 2001 and is based in the Atlanta bureau."]
